Jim, Rich,
Believe it or not there was a Hayashi Shigemitsu in Sotheby's June sale, lot
180, it was even illustrated. It was missed by almost everybody including
myself, perhaps I should give up swords/tsuba and collect stamps, it even
had the Hayashi stamp on the reverse!.
Alan

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hayashi Shigemitsu
messages.msgSnippet: Jim, Rich, Believe it or not there was a Hayashi Shigemitsu in Sotheby s June sale, lot 180, it was even illustrated. It was missed by almost everybody
messages.messageBody:
Jim, Rich,
Believe it or not there was a Hayashi Shigemitsu in Sotheby's June sale, lot
180, it was even illustrated. It was missed by almost everybody including
myself, perhaps I should give up swords/tsuba and collect stamps, it even
had the Hayashi stamp on the reverse!.
Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 18, 2003 12:11 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hayashi Shigemitsu


: Rich,
: I only just got my issue. The comment about it being the 2nd outside of
Japan is a reference to the October issue where there was another example
published with the claim of it being believed to be the only signed example
outside of Japan. How one would verify such a claim I don't know, but it's
a bit hard to believe. Certainly attributed work is more common than
signed.
:
: Shigemitsu is the second generation of the Hayashi line after Matashichi,
the founder. His work is well thought of, but is overshadowed by
Matashichi, I think. You'll find examples in the Higo sections of Sasano's
sukashi tsuba books, in general tsuba books or of course in ones focusing on
Higo. Understanding the ins and outs of the Higo sukashi groups is
challenging.
:
: Jim
:
:
:
: All, just received my december issue of To-Ron and there is an
absolutely gorgeous sukashi guard by Hayashi Shigemitsu. I see noted it is
only the 2nd knw guard outside of Japan by this artist. How rare is his
work, how highly is he rated ??.
:
: Cheers
:
: Rich
:
: [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hayashi Shigemitsu
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, I only just got my issue.  The comment about it being the 2nd outside of Japan is a reference to the October issue where there was another example
messages.messageBody:
Rich,
I only just got my issue. The comment about it being the 2nd outside of Japan is a reference to the October issue where there was another example published with the claim of it being believed to be the only signed example outside of Japan. How one would verify such a claim I don't know, but it's a bit hard to believe. Certainly attributed work is more common than signed.

Shigemitsu is the second generation of the Hayashi line after Matashichi, the founder. His work is well thought of, but is overshadowed by Matashichi, I think. You'll find examples in the Higo sections of Sasano's sukashi tsuba books, in general tsuba books or of course in ones focusing on Higo. Understanding the ins and outs of the Higo sukashi groups is challenging.

Jim



All, just received my december issue of To-Ron and there is an absolutely gorgeous sukashi guard by Hayashi Shigemitsu. I see noted it is only the 2nd knw guard outside of Japan by this artist. How rare is his work, how highly is he rated ??.

Cheers

Rich

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hayashi Shigemitsu
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Rich, English translation of the Kinko Meikan lists him as AA smith out of a 4 A rating. Lou [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
Hey Rich,
English translation of the Kinko Meikan lists him as "AA" smith out of a
4 A rating.

Lou


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
All, just received my december issue of To-Ron and there is an absolutely gorgeous sukashi guard by Hayashi Shigemitsu. I see noted it is only the 2nd knw guard outside of Japan by this artist. How rare is his work, how highly is he rated ??.

Cheers

Rich
